org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.opt

Class AbstractSimulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.opt.AbstractSimulation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Simulation
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EfficientSimulation, NaiveSimulation, RefinedSimulation, SchematicSimulation

    public abstract class AbstractSimulation
extends java.lang.Object
implements Simulation
    This class provides a default implementation of Simulation for FSA.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractSimulation(FSA aut)
      Constructs this object to compute the fair simulation relations between states in a specified automaton.

      Constructs this object to compute the simulation relations between states in a specified automaton.

      static boolean[][] getDirectTransitionSymbolSimulation(FSA aut, State[] states)
      Returns an array b such that b[i][j] is true if and only if the outgoing transition symbols of states[i] are contained in the outgoing transition symbols of states[j].

      Returns an array b such that b[i][j] is true if and only if states[i] can be simulated by states[j] in the acceptance condition.

      Returns the predecessors of a set of states in a label-on-state automaton from the cache.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractSimulation

        public AbstractSimulation(FSA aut)
        Constructs this object to compute the fair simulation relations between states in a specified automaton. This constructor will also create caches for accessing successors and predecessors of states. The fair simulation is taken into account.
        Parameters:
        aut - where the simulation relations should be computed

      • AbstractSimulation

        public AbstractSimulation(FSA aut,
                          boolean fair)
        Constructs this object to compute the simulation relations between states in a specified automaton. This constructor will also create caches for accessing successors and predecessors of states.
        Parameters:
        aut - where the simulation relations should be computed
        fair - true if the fair simulation should be considered

    • Method Detail

      • getDirectTransitionSymbolSimulation

        public static boolean[][] getDirectTransitionSymbolSimulation(FSA aut,
                                                              State[] states)
        Returns an array b such that b[i][j] is true if and only if the outgoing transition symbols of states[i] are contained in the outgoing transition symbols of states[j].
        Parameters:
        aut - an automaton
        states - the states in aut
        Returns:
        an array indicating if the outgoing transition symbols of a state are contained in the outgoing transition symbols of another state

      • getReverseTransitionSymbolSimulation

        public static boolean[][] getReverseTransitionSymbolSimulation(FSA aut,
                                                               State[] states)
        Returns an array b such that b[i][j] is true if and only if the incoming transition symbols of states[i] are contained in the incoming transition symbols of states[j].
        Parameters:
        aut - an automaton
        states - the states in aut
        Returns:
        an array indicating if the incoming transition symbols of a state are contained in the incoming transition symbols of another state

      • getStateSymbolSimulation

        public static boolean[][] getStateSymbolSimulation(FSA aut,
                                                   State[] states)
        Returns an array b such that b[i][j] is true if and only if the symbols on states[i] can be simulated by the symbols on states[j].
        Parameters:
        aut - an automaton
        states - the states in aut
        Returns:
        an array indicating if the symbols on a state can be simualted by the symbols on another state

      • isStateSymbolSimulated

        public static boolean isStateSymbolSimulated(AlphabetType type,
                                             State si,
                                             State sj)
        Returns true if the symbols on a state can be simulated by the symbols on another state.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of alphabet
        si - a state in aut
        sj - a state in aut
        Returns:
        true if the symbols on si can be simulated by the symbols on sj

      • getFairSimulation

        public static boolean[][] getFairSimulation(FSA aut,
                                            State[] states)
        Returns an array b such that b[i][j] is true if and only if states[i] can be simulated by states[j] in the acceptance condition.
        Parameters:
        aut - an automaton
        states - the states in the automaton
        Returns:
        an array indicating if a state can be simulated by another state in the acceptance condition

      • isFairStateSimulated

        public static boolean isFairStateSimulated(FSA aut,
                                           State s1,
                                           State s2)
        Returns true if for every acceptance set F in the acceptance condition of a specified automaton, s1 is in F implies s2 is also in F.
        Parameters:
        aut - an automaton
        s1 - a state in aut
        s2 - a state in aut
        Returns:
        true if for every acceptance set F in the acceptance condition of aut, s1 is in F implies s2 is also in F

      • isFairTransitionSimulated

        public static boolean isFairTransitionSimulated(FSA aut,
                                                Transition t1,
                                                Transition t2)
        Returns true if for every acceptance set F in the acceptance condition of a specified automaton, t1 is in F implies tt2 is also in F.
        Parameters:
        aut - an automaton
        t1 - a transition in aut
        t2 - a transition in aut
        Returns:
        true if for every acceptance set F in the acceptance condition of aut, t1 is in F implies t2 is also in F

      • isDirectSimulationEquivalent

        public boolean isDirectSimulationEquivalent(State s1,
                                            State s2)
        Description copied from interface: Simulation
        Returns true if s1 is direct simulation equivalent to s2. State s1 and state s2 are direct simulation equivalent if and only if they can direct simulate each other. This method should be invoked after Simulation.computeDirectSimulationRelation() .
        Specified by:
        isDirectSimulationEquivalent in interface Simulation
        Parameters:
        s1 - a state
        s2 - a state
        Returns:
        true if s1 is direct simulation equivalent to s2

      • isReverseSimulationEquivalent

        public boolean isReverseSimulationEquivalent(State s1,
                                             State s2)
        Description copied from interface: Simulation
        Returns true if s1 is reverse simulation equivalent to s2. State s1 and state s2 are reverse simulation equivalent if and only if they can reverse simulate each other. This method should be invoked after Simulation.computeReverseSimulationRelation().
        Specified by:
        isReverseSimulationEquivalent in interface Simulation
        Parameters:
        s1 - a state
        s2 - a state
        Returns:
        true if s1 is reverse simulation equivalent to s2

      • getDirectSimulationEquivalentSets

        public java.util.Set<StateSet> getDirectSimulationEquivalentSets()
        Description copied from interface: Simulation
        Returns the direct simulation equivalence sets. For each set, every two states in the set are direct simulation equivalent. This method should be invoked after Simulation.computeDirectSimulationRelation().
        Specified by:
        getDirectSimulationEquivalentSets in interface Simulation
        Returns:
        the direct simulation equivalence sets

      • getReverseSimulationEquivalentSets

        public java.util.Set<StateSet> getReverseSimulationEquivalentSets()
        Description copied from interface: Simulation
        Returns the reverse simulation equivalence sets. For each set, every two states in the set are reverse simulation equivalent. This method should be invoked after Simulation.computeReverseSimulationRelation().
        Specified by:
        getReverseSimulationEquivalentSets in interface Simulation
        Returns:
        the reverse simulation equivalence sets
